sentence.text: Al-Awadi-Raas-Rothschild syndrome (AARRS; OMIM 276820) is a very rare autosomal recessive limb malformation syndrome caused by regulation of presynapse assembly mutations.

Whole exome sequencing of the patient and his parents ruled out mutations in 11 known hypodontia-associated genes including canonical Wnt signaling pathway, cell morphogenesis, positive regulation of NF-kappaB transcription factor activity, EDAR, EDARADD, PAX9, cellular protein localization, embryonic body morphogenesis, NEMO, signal transduction, and negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II.

entity.text: positive regulation of NF-kappaB transcription factor activity
negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: All lines of evidence suggest that regulation of presynapse assembly has important role in tooth development and its mutation may lead to tooth agenesis, microdontia, and taurodontism.
